title: Valley Forge National Historical Park: Park Home
body: Determined to Persevere  Valley Forge was the site of the 1777-78 winter encampment of the Continental Army. The park commemorates the sacrifices and perseverance of the Revolutionary War generation and honors the ability of citizens to pull together and overcome adversity during extraordinary times! Read More             Ranger Programs   Get insider knowledge from a Park Ranger!            Centennial Celebration Day   Join us on August 27th, 2016 to celebrate the 100th birthday of the National Park Service with a full day of activities for all ages.        Official Sullivan's Bridge Opening   Join us August 19 for a ribbon cutting for Sullivanâ€™s Bridge. Be among the first visitors to cross the new bridge over the Schuylkill River!              Crayfish Corps   Valley Forge is under attack, help us win the war against the invasive Rusty Crayfish!         Wildlife Watchers   Be a citizen scientist at Valley Forge. It's easy to do!        National Park Service Centennial   The National Park Service is 100 years old, come celebrate with us!
